1.Pros: It pays not well but it pays
1.Cons: Managment and customers really, plus no benefits

2.Pros: Working with the public the fast paced environment getting to know your regular customers. And being able to train staff to advance
2.Cons: Staffing issues having broken equipment not getting fixed not having the proper equipment to run the store call offs and ncns

4.Pros: There was a lot of great people to work with and it was a good clean environment
4.Cons: they had so many people there and when new people get hired everybody else looses a lot of hours

5.Pros: Great work experience in a leadership role and customer service.
5.Cons: High employee turnover rate lack of reliable employees ,too many unexperienced shift Managers

7.Pros: Everyday is a little different, seeing a smile on a customers face because I placed their order in a timely manner. Or holding the door open for my regulars who come in every morning.
7.Cons: Sometimes the day doesn’t go very well. Some people might not show up or it is unexpectedly busy. I have to change my plans but I always end up coming up with a different solution to any problem

8.Pros: Working with people who love there job

9.Pros: Working can help you pay for your new car or if you have and bills you need to pay for.
9.Cons: You could get annoyed with some of the customers if they have an attitude towards you but you just have to stay calm.
